text: User Reviews .This review contains spoilers , click expand to view .This the most horrible movie I 've ever seen in my entire life .This sentence alone should be enough to explain this movie ...BUT I have to tell more of course .First of all , I have n't watched all of the movies nor read the books ; I 've only watched part 1 and I really hated it , but at least that movie was just boring and that 's it .In here , it 's a slap to your expectations , a betrayal of hope , a disaster of story .

YES , I do know that in the books it ended " technically " like this , but then ... what was the point of making " THAT " scene if you 're going to rip everyone off !I feel so disappointed , not as a fan ( which I 'm NOT ) , but as a person who tries to enjoys movies .I do n't know what else to say , except that I wish I did n't watch it .... for those who really want to see the ending to this saga ...I would say avoid it .... or go ahead and make yourself home I .. have no words to describe how terrible this was .

Expand .Do n't need to say much here , a lot have gone over the plot points that are terrible , the awful cinematography and lousy GOD - DAMNED STUPID FAKE OUT ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !The tale of two star - crossed lovers has finally reached its conclusion .The unlikely romance of a human and a vampire has been at the center of pop culture since 2008 when the first Twilight movie was thrown into the wild , for teenage girls to attach themselves to like a bee to honey .

The first half of this film maybe the worst in the franchise .Between the CGI baby and continuing the the terrible storyline from part 1 it looked like it was headed for a 0 or 1 .Once the girl grows up and the story changes more towards the battle the 2nd half became the best of the franchise .Overall I found the ending to be poor and hopefully we 've seen the end of this franchise .An extremely bad and disappointing conclusion to the Twilight Series , whose team was unwilling to make a decent film for the audience .

This POS movie is one of the worst I have ever seen in my entire life .When I was forced to see this I thought maybe it would be like transformers were it 's so bad that it 's good but no it was so bad that it made me want to rip my eyes out so I could stop watching it .Review from an 18 year old guy .I went into this ( obviously not willingly ) thinking / hoping to destroy it .And at first , it seemed like I could .But the slow hour leads to an actually entertaining and violent battle scene , only to be finished by an ending that will leave many people , diehards or casual fans alike , split .

Not awful but Review from an 18 year old guy .I went into this ( obviously not willingly ) thinking / hoping to destroy it .And at first , it seemed like I could .But the slow hour leads to an actually entertaining and violent battle scene , only to be finished by an ending that will leave many people , diehards or casual fans alike , split .I was not fond of the ending , but my girlfriend was .Not awful but besides the great battle it 's pretty slow . ...Expand .

It exhausting watching that much cheese .I 've read the books , so I already knew what was going to happen , but somehow it does n't seem that cheesy until you see bad actors act it out with angsty piano music .That being said , it certainly was n't worse than the other movies .Oh , wait , except for a suger creepy CGI baby .WTF ?Ca n't you just use a real baby ?I do n't Oh God , so cheesy !It exhausting watching that much cheese .I 've read the books , so I already knew what was going to happen , but somehow it does n't seem that cheesy until you see bad actors act it out with angsty piano music .

Oh , wait , except for a suger creepy CGI baby .WTF ?Ca n't you just use a real baby ?I do n't care what the book says , it having teeth is n't really that important , just use a real baby .People in the theatre were " aww"-ing like it was cute .It 's not cute , it 's face is covered in poorly done CGI .Atleast Renesmee does n't stay a baby for long .The climax and ending were well done until a lame montage of Edward+Bella moments from the whole series at the very end .

Expand .Let me start this review by saying that I have read all the books in this series and watched all the movies to date and frankly I 'm not a fan .Why do I continue to watch each installment then ?Because I am a fan of how directors interpret text onto the big screen and I can whole heartedly say that Bill Condon 's take on this ' B Script ' novel is to be commended .He adds all the missing Let me start this review by saying that I have read all the books in this series and watched all the movies to date and frankly I 'm not a fan .

Because I am a fan of how directors interpret text onto the big screen and I can whole heartedly say that Bill Condon 's take on this ' B Script ' novel is to be commended .He adds all the missing pieces of the book whilst still staying true to the novel itself , which is no easy task .The acting all around is good , however Michael Sheen ( Aro ) steals the show with a stellar performance as the series ' villain .The certain aspect of this movie that really redeemed the series as a whole however is its ending - it is everything you would expect from a grand finale with jaw dropping sequences , beautifully choreographed set pieces and edge of your seat action all the way through .

Whilst this is n't a very glamourous movie ( the CGI Reneesme looked quite awful at times and cast members apart from the main characters had little to no substance ) it 's ending is truly one that will be remembered .Remembered not for it 's engagement or action sequences , but for its adaptation from paper to screen .A bunch of words that lacked execution and if copied word for word would have crumbled on the big screen .However a clever director carefully tailored this delicate story to not only suit a cinema audience , but also occasional readers , action orientated fans and Twi - hards alike .

Expand .In the end , its a recommendable sendoff for the series , but just barely .Problems still remain .Part 2 lacks a big conflict and instead goes in the " what if " scenario .While nicely filmed , it can sometimes be unintentionally funny just like Part 1 .Again , Twilight is n't for everyone , but this may be the best of the series .The Twilight Saga ends on a high note , but is it very high ?No .Yet the performances are solid except for a few , the visual and special effects are stunning , and it is beautifully filmed .

It embraces its absurdity and complete dumbness with ease .Although in the end they should n't have made a last minute change , and The Twilight Saga ends on a high note , but is it very high ?No .Yet the performances are solid except for a few , the visual and special effects are stunning , and it is beautifully filmed .It manages to be funny throughout the film , but this time on purpose .It embraces its absurdity and complete dumbness with ease .Although in the end they should n't have made a last minute change , and should have left it where it was going it still manages to leave you happy in a way .

Most people who have not read the books will think it is stupid and weird , but if you have you will enjoy it .I do not like the Twilight films but this left me liking it , but not loving it .I give this film 62 % . ...Expand .Best movie from the series , but the script , acting and effects are still bad , even though that 's not the actual movie 's fault , since none of those things needed to be better for the movie to have a huge gross .

For movies that are adapted from books to be successful , the book itself must be of respectable quality .This successfully classifies as one of the worst films in existence .Get ready to see the spectacle that should never have started in the first place ! ...Expand .Of all the major critics ' reviews , Joe Williams of the St. Louis Dispatch has it right : it was a guilty pleasure for these 58 year old eyes .I enjoyed every minute of it , especially a truly electrifying moment at the end .So did the audience .

Ce film est vraiment énorme avec la super surprise vers la fin du film le générique final est énorme ! ! ! !Je ne vois d'autre note alors oui je mes 10/10 sans ésiter ! ! ! ...Expand .After following the franchise from the beginning , falling for Edward instantly , and generally enjoying the books a great deal more than the films .I have to say this final instalment was a huge winner for me .Its fair to say the cgi of Renesme is not great and the majority is a Bella / Edward love - fest , but the grand finale scene is absolutely amazing and completely unexpected .

I have to say this final instalment was a huge winner for me .Its fair to say the cgi of Renesme is not great and the majority is a Bella / Edward love - fest , but the grand finale scene is absolutely amazing and completely unexpected .My palms were sweaty and my heart beating so fast .I could n't believe what was happening .An amazing ending for a brilliant saga !Well done Bill . ...Expand .First thing 's first : I am not a Twilight fan .Therefore , giving the film a 5/10 is quite good , mind you .

To tell the truth , this is not a bad film .Nor is it a good film .It 's there in between , in mediocrity .Let 's start with visuals - the First thing 's first : I am not a Twilight fan .Therefore , giving the film a 5/10 is quite good , mind you .I had not seen the one film before , because I thought " New Moon " was horrible , horrible , horrible , but a friend took me out so figured might as well .To tell the truth , this is not a bad film .

It 's there in between , in mediocrity .Let 's start with visuals - the effects can be pretty nice , but I just could n't get over the horrible editing with them , especially when they run " supersonic " or whatever it is .Made the film look amateurish and cheap .Other effects were quite good .Acting - not bad .Stewart , whom I usually dislike strongly , was actually bearable .The rest of the cast was ok , too .Storyline was a bit problematic .Ultimately , nothing really happens in the film .

This is it !The big finish !Bella and Edward are married and have given birth to a human / vampire hybrid .This poses problems with the evil empire , so the family gathers vampires from around the globe , allowing for an extended sequence to show off a variety of skills and special effects .While it 's mildly cool , the build - up never builds up much steam .The showdown has lots of head - popping This is it !The big finish !Bella and Edward are married and have given birth to a human / vampire hybrid .

While it 's mildly cool , the build - up never builds up much steam .The showdown has lots of head - popping action , but it 's not enough .There are questions left unanswered and the lame conclusion is just that .Fans of the series will be thrilled to see it played out , but as a standalone film , it 's just OK .The pacing is dramatic but slow .Watching the plot unfold is interesting , but it 's never thrilling ( and those werewolves still look fake ) . ...Expand .

I am actually quite disappointed because I had given Twilight , Eclipse , and Breaking Dawn part 1 6 's .I had given New Moon an 8 .I figured it would at least be a decent film but it ended up being a terrible end to a solid franchise .And this is coming from a guy who loves action , horror , and comedy films . ...Expand .Bloodless decapitations are everywhere in the climax that did n't actually happen .This movie is a train wreck .Even the actors seem to hate what they have created .

Immortal ?Let 's hope not .Watch this as a comedy , and it 's kind of funny .Finally !The last film in this terrible franchise .Now the problem is n't the story , its well written if a bit irritating because of the whole changing conventions of vampires & werewolves .The problem all along has lied solely in the directors & casting directors hands .Breaking Dawn pt 2 takes place abut 3 days after pt 1 .Renesme is developing fast , Bella is learning her new powers and Finally !The last film in this terrible franchise .

The problem all along has lied solely in the directors & casting directors hands .Breaking Dawn pt 2 takes place abut 3 days after pt 1 .Renesme is developing fast , Bella is learning her new powers and the Volturi are coming to kill the Cullens for turning a child into a vampire , even though she was born a half - vampire .It ties up the story very nicely though the massive fight scene ( though probably the highlight of the franchise ) really was n't needed and it would have worked better without it .

You 'll love it if you like Twilight but if you do nt then just steer clear , like you have probably done so already . ...Expand .I really liked the movie .We could see a savage battle between vampires and werewolves ( like in the other movies ) .The kind of scene you do n't expect to see in a movie that once was focused in the love story between Edward and Bella .There is also a great diplomacy game among the vampires , revealing all the power , political positions and that kind of stuff that we hardly see in a vampire movie .

This one , however , was extremely boring the whole way through .I was quite optimistic walking into the cinema with my friends , but as soon as the first scene came on , I wanted to tear my eyeballs out .On the other hand , the movie gets better when the story line develops Over all the twilight saga 's , I have found scenes extremely gripping and then also on the other hand extremely boring .This one , however , was extremely boring the whole way through .I was quite optimistic walking into the cinema with my friends , but as soon as the first scene came on , I wanted to tear my eyeballs out .

I have read the books , and to be fair , they are so much better than the films .As a teenager who can " relate " to the movies , I feel no real connections with the vampires and werewolves in the film , like I do in the book .I do n't see why twilight has the stereotype of being particularly for teenagers .I know many adults who enjoy a romantic fantasy now and again .Overall , I believe that if you want a good read , go for the books .However , the film is not worthwhile to go and spend your money on .
